parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the fuel pump flange can cause fuel to leak, potentially leading to a fire hazard, and can also cause the engine to stall or lose power, leading to accidents or leaving the driver stranded.
symptoms: Fuel leaking from the upper left fairing area

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the throttle body pulley can cause the throttle to stick, leading to loss of control and potential accidents, especially if it occurs while in motion.
The failure of the fuel level sensor can cause inaccurate fuel level readings, leading to potential running out of fuel, stalling, or engine damage.
symptoms: Fuel level sensor not working properly

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the rear differential (final drive) can cause loss of traction, vibration, and sudden brake failure, leading to accidents or leaving the rider stranded.
symptoms: Grinding and squealing noises from the rear of the vehicle
and resistance in the rear wheel.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the fuel sensor can cause the fuel gauge to display incorrect information, leading to unexpected fuel depletion, which can result in accidents, especially on high-speed roads, and may require emergency assistance.
symptoms: The fuel gauge shows incorrect or inconsistent readings
the fuel gauge suddenly drops to empty
the vehicle runs out of fuel despite the gauge indicating remaining fuel
the analog and digital gauges display different readings.
